revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Achievements and Awards in 1971
tldr: In this anniversary address, President A. L. Hodgkin highlights the scientific achievements and awards presented in 1971. Notable recipients include N. W. Pirie for his work on viruses, G. Herzberg for his spectroscopic research, and D. F. Perutz for his contributions to understanding the structure and function of hemoglobin. Additionally, the address mentions the significant advancements in geology, chemistry, and other scientific fields during that year.
